page.title: 05Housing in Stackpole
page.content: The other nine houses were built in the nineteenth century.All have been kept in a good state of repair and all except three are now privately owned.Two are used as summer cottages.One house,which enjoys a commanding position in the village,was built in the early nineteen eighties on the site of an older property. In the area there are nine large farmhouses of indeterminate age;although all are at least 150 years old.Seven are still occupied by farmers but one is lived in by the National Trust Warden and another is now a private house.Some have cottages attached which were previously lived in by farm workers.Nine of these cottages were built in the last century and two fairly recently. .
